column1: # Table of geomorphic characteristics used to select example reaches from the GUT database  For each River Style and condition of interest.

column2: [factor] Name of basin river style is defined for
[factor] defined river style or process domain of interest, usually mapped across the entire network after  Brierly and Fryirs ().
[factor] user defined abbreviation for river style
[factor] Condition varient as poor, moderate, good or intact after Brierly and Fryirs ().
[numeric] Lower limit of dimensionless gradient ratio
[numeric] Upper limit of dimensionless gradient ratio. NA values imply no upper limit
[numeric] Upper limit of sinuosity. NA values imply no upper limit
[numeric] Lower limit of Frequency of # of large wood pieces(>1m by 10cm) per 100  m length of stream.
[numeric] Upper limit of Frequency of # of large wood pieces (>1m by 10cm) per 100  m length of stream. NA values imply no upper limit
[numeric] Lower limit of braid index- ratio of total channel length/main channel length
[numeric] Upper limit of braid index- ratio of total channel length/main channel length. NA values imply no upper limit
[numeric] Single value of braiding index to be used as a scalar to adjust channel area for multi threads. Usually the average or median.
[List] Possible multi channel character (Single, Transitional, Multi) after Rinaldi, et al. 2015
[List] Possible characteristic bedform types after Montgomery and Buffington, 1999 (Plane Bed, Pool-Riffle, Step-Pool, Rapid, Cascade) separated by a semi colon
[List] Possible predominant substrate type (Sand; Gravel; Cobble; Boulder) separated by semi colons.
[character] logical epression for type of confinement (Confined, Partly Confined, Unconfined) Using IS or NOT after Brierly and Fryirs ()
